thread.title: "Steve Jobs" Star Jeff Daniels Discusses Why the Apple Visionary Was a 'Genius'
thread.title_full: "Steve Jobs" Star Jeff Daniels Discusses Why the Apple Visionary Was a 'Genius'

title: "Steve Jobs" Star Jeff Daniels Discusses Why the Apple Visionary Was a 'Genius'
text:
"Steve Jobs" Star Jeff Daniels Discusses Why the Apple Visionary Was a 'Genius' Posted just a moment ago 
Francois Duhamel/Universal (LOS ANGELES) -- Why was Steve Jobs a genius? One of the actors from the new movie Steve Jobs has an idea. 
Jeff Daniels plays former Apple CEO John Sculley in the film. Sculley was kind of a father figure to the late Apple co-founder. 
Daniels tells ABC Radio that Jobs was a tortured genius. "He was changing the world, but he had some big issues," he says. 
That made Jobs "impossible to work with and for," Daniels notes. 
Yet people stayed with him, Daniels says, because of his genius. What was that genius exactly? 
"[T]his ability to, I know what the world is going to want 10 years from now," Daniels says. 
Steve Jobs , the movie, expands into theaters nationwide Friday.
